etymology.description: semantic: 匚(匚) (fāng, 'box') + phonetic: 儿(兒) (ér, 'child') = unit of measure -> equal
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the semantic component 匚(匚) (fāng, 'box'), suggesting a container or unit, with the phonetic 儿(兒) (ér, 'child'), to convey the idea of items that are measured or considered in equal units.

examples.chinese: 他的能力匹敌(他的能力匹敵)。
examples.english: His ability is equal to that of his rivals.

examples.chinese: 他努力奋斗(他努力奮鬥)，与优秀对手匹敌(與優秀對手匹敵)。
examples.pinyin: tā nǔlì fèndòu, yǔ yōuxiù duìshǒu pǐ dí.
examples.english: He works hard, and his effort makes him equal to his outstanding opponents.
